intro: Physaria saximontana subsp. dentata, commonly known as the toothed bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive serrated or toothed edge, giving it its subspecies name. The fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
